title: Rotational kinematics - ang acceleration of wheel

content.question: A wheel of radius <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> is initially at rest when it begins spinning about a central axis with constant angular acceleration. A point on the rim of the wheel moves a distance of <math alttext="s" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math> of over a time interval <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>. Which of the following expressions is equal to the angular acceleration of the wheel?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction R over s t squared" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>R</mi><mrow><mi>s</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction 2 R s over t squared" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction s over 2 R t squared" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>s</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction 2 s over R t squared" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 2 s over R t squared" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
